head.supplied: 30 June [18]86. ¶ Sir, ¶ ¶ I have the honor to inform you that the Governor in Council has made an Order under section 100 of the Public Service Act 1883 requiring you, notwithstanding your having at...

div.p: No.4007, p. 1260, unit 73, VPRS 1187/P, outward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I have the honor to inform you that the Governor in Council has made an Order under section 100 of the Public Service Act 1883 requiring you, notwithstanding your having attained the age of sixty years, to continue to perform your duties until the 31st December 1886.

p.style: font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in; font-family: Geneva;

div.p: I have the honor to be,

p.style: font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in; font-family: Geneva;
font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in; font-family: Geneva;
font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in; font-family: Geneva;

div.p:
The Government Botanist
See M to T. Wilson, 1 July 1886 (in this edition as 86-07-01a).
